briefdescription.para: String indicating in scale mode the user is using (raw, scale by the maximum, scale by the shoulder) in the correlationView.
String indicating what is the status of the processing of the waveform information.
String indicating in which presentation mode the user is (sample, time frame).
Sampling rate (time between two samples) in micro seconds.

A array which contains the features for each spike: the principal componants the Valley to peak amplitude the peak to valley amplitude the max of the to previous data the width of the spike the time of the spike.
A two line array which contains sorted by cluster numbers and then by time: the row index of the spike in features the id of the cluster.
Represents a list of clusterInfoMap use to enable undo action.
Represents a list of clusterInfoMap use to enable redo action.
Contains ClusterInfo key: cluster number value: a ClusterInfo (which gives: the index of the first spike in spikesByCluster and the number of spikes for a given cluster).
Represents a list of clusterInfoMap use to enable undo action.
Represents a list of clusterInfoMap use to enable redo action.
List of the maximum of each dimension.
List of the minimum of each dimension.
List of the clusters giving the maximum of each dimension (sorted by dimension).
List of the clusters giving the minimum of each dimension (sorted by dimension).
QT object providing access serialization between threads.
List containing the the dimension change status of each action of the undo list.
List containing the the dimension change status of each action of the redo list.

True is the data where recording using a 12 or 16 bits recording system which gives data coded on 2 bytes, false otherwise (the recording is then assume to be 32 bits and then the data are coded on 4 bytes.
Map containing the waveform status by cluster.

detaileddescription.para: Only the clusters for which information have been asked are present in this map.

briefdescription.para: Dictionary containing the waveform data by cluster.

detaileddescription.para: Only the clusters for which data have been asked are present in this dictionary.

briefdescription.para: Boolean use to inform the MinMaxThread that an undo or a redo is in process and that it has to stop.
Boolean use to inform the MinMaxThread that the cluster 0 has changed and that it has to stop.
Stores the information to know which cluster has correlations in process.
Dict containing the correlations.

detaileddescription.para: Key: a string representing the pair of clusters (id1-id2). The first value of the pair is always the bigger (the correlograms are calculated stored only for (A,B) with A > B and not for (B,A). value: a qdict containing a pair as a key and a Correlation object as a value. The pair represent the the bin size and the time window of the Correlation object.

briefdescription.para: Excerpt of spikesByCluster for the clusters selected to be recluster.
Map given the cluster user information, the key is the cluster id and the value an instance of ClusterUserInformation.

detaileddescription.para: This map is only used to store the data read from or write to the parameter file (xml).

the id of the electrode group currently opened.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the minimum and maximum for each dimension and store them in dimensionMinima and dimensionMaxima respectively.

memberdef.argsstring: (QRegion &region, const QValueList< int > &clustersOfOrigin, int dimensionX, int dimensionY, QValueList< int > &fromClusters, QValueList< int > &emptyClusters)
memberdef.name: createNewCluster

briefdescription.para: Creates a new cluster out of existing ones.

parameterdescription.para: the polygon defining the area containing the spikes for the new cluster.
a list of the cluster numbers identifying the clusters which may contain spikes in the region
the dimension used as absciss to display the clusters
the dimension used as ordinate to display the clusters
an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which really contained spikes in the region
an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.

simplesect.para: the number of the newly created cluster or 0 if no cluster have been created (no spikes selected). This is safe as cluster 0 (artifact) can never be created that way.

memberdef.argsstring: (QRegion &region, const QValueList< int > &clustersOfOrigin, int dimensionX, int dimensionY, QValueList< int > &emptyClusters)
memberdef.name: createNewClusters

briefdescription.para: Creates a new clusters out of existing ones.

detaileddescription.para:
If the polygon of selection contains x clusters x new clusters will be created.
region
the polygon defining the area containing the spikes for the new cluster.
clustersOfOrigin
a list of the cluster numbers identifying the clusters which may contain spikes in the region
dimensionX
the dimension used as absciss to display the clusters
dimensionY
the dimension used as ordinate to display the clusters
emptyClusters
an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
a map where the keys are ids of the clusters which really contained spikes in the region and the values are the ids of the newly created clusters.

memberdef.argsstring: (QRegion &region, const QValueList< int > &clustersOfOrigin, int destinationCluster, int dimensionX, int dimensionY, QValueList< int > &fromClusters, QValueList< int > &emptyClusters)
memberdef.name: deleteSpikesFromClusters

briefdescription.para: Removes spikes from some clusters and assign them to the cluster destinationCluster which is either the cluster 0, corresponding to the artifact, or the cluster 1, corresponding to the noise.

parameterdescription.para: the polygon defining the area containing the spikes corresponding to the noise.
a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters which may contain spikes in the region
the cluster number to assign the spikes contained in the region
an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which really contained spikes in the region
the dimension used as absciss to display the clusters
the dimension used as ordinate to display the clusters
an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the clusters contained in clustersToDelete.

detaileddescription.para:
The correponding spikes are assign to cluster 1 (the noise)
clustersToDelete
a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters to delete.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the clusters contained in clustersToDelete.

detaileddescription.para:
The correponding spikes are assign to cluster 0 (the artifact)
clustersToDelete
a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters to delete.

briefdescription.para: Groups the clusters contained in clustersToGroup.

detaileddescription.para:
The correponding spikes are assign to a new cluster. The user information of the different clusters to be grouped will be concatenated.
clustersToGroup
a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters to group
the number of the newly created cluster.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of dimensions of the data.
Reverts the last user action.

parameterdescription.para: list of clusters which were added (can be empty).
list of clusters which were modified (can be empty).

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last undo action.

parameterdescription.para: list of clusters which were added (can be empty).
list of clusters which were modified (can be empty).
list of clusters which were deleted (can be empty).

briefdescription.para: Renumbers the clusters, so the the clusterIds will be consecutive.

parameterdescription.para: map between old and new cluster ids.
map between new and old cluster ids.

briefdescription.para: Makes all the internal changes due to a modification of the number of undo.

parameterdescription.para: the futur new number of undo.

briefdescription.para: Creates and returns an iterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

parameterdescription.para: the number of the cluster on which spikes the iterator will iterates.

simplesect.para: the iterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

briefdescription.para: Returns the list of cluster Ids.
Returns the maximum for the dimension.

parameterdescription.para: for which the maximum is requested. Numbering starts at 1

briefdescription.para: Returns the minimum for the dimension.

parameterdescription.para: for which the minimum is requested. Numbering starts at 1

briefdescription.para: Saves the clusters information to file.

parameterdescription.para: the .clu.i file

simplesect.para: true if the data have been successfully saved to file, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of points used to describe a waveform.

detaileddescription.para: Each point correspond to a diffrent instant in time.

briefdescription.para: Returns the position of the peak among the points decribing the waveform.
Returns the number of channels used.
Returns the total number of PCAs used (number of channels times number of PCA by channel).
Returns the sampling interval (time between two samples) in second.
Returns the dimension for the time.
Returns the maximum value for the time dimension in seconds.
Gives information on how the data were recorded.

detaileddescription.para: True if the data where recording using a 12 or 16 bits recording system which gives data coded on 2 bytes, false otherwise, (the recording is then assume to be 32 bits and then the data are coded on 4 bytes).

briefdescription.para: Gets a onr row SortableTable with the spike positions for the cluster clusterId.

parameterdescription.para: d of the cluster for which the spike position are search.
the array where the result of the search will be store.

simplesect.para: true if the cluster exist and the data have been retreive, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of points corresponding to a spike.

detaileddescription.para: This equals to: nbChannels * nbSamplesInWaveform

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of spikes of the cluster.

parameterdescription.para: id of the cluster for which the number of spikes is requested.

simplesect.para: the number of spikes of the cluster clusterId.

briefdescription.para: Returns the total number of spikes.
Returns the current number of clusters.

memberdef.argsstring: (int clusterId, QString structure, QString type, QString ID, QString quality, QString notes)
memberdef.name: setUserClusterInformation

briefdescription.para: Assignes to the cluster the information given by the user.

parameterdescription.para: id of the cluster for which the information are given.
structure in which the cluster is supposed to be.
type of the cluster.
Isolation distance of the cluster.
quality of the cluster.
notes of any type on the cluster.

briefdescription.para: Gest the cluster the information given by the user.

parameterdescription.para: id of the cluster for which the information are given.

simplesect.para: array of QString containing the following information (in the following order) : structure in which the cluster is supposed to be. type of the cluster. Isolation distance of the cluster. quality of the cluster. notes of any type on the cluster.

briefdescription.para: Gets the map of cluster user information.

parameterdescription.para: the current electrod group id.
map given the cluster user information, the key is the cluster id and the value an instance of ClusterUserInformation.

briefdescription.para: Creates the feature file to automatically recluster the clusters contained in clustersToRecluster.

parameterdescription.para: list of clusters to recluster.
file to which the data will be saved.

briefdescription.para: Integrates the clusters obtained by automatic reclustering.

detaileddescription.para:
Suppress the reclustered ones and add the newly created ones.
clustersToRecluster
list of clusters reclustered.
reclusteredClusterList
output parameter, the list of the newly created clusters. The list will be empty if the integration is not successful.
clusterFile
cluster file created by the automatic reclustering program.
true if the integration is successful, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Informs if the the variables need it by the traceView are available.

detaileddescription.para:
Those variables are retrieve only from the parameter file in xml format (the new for
true if the variables are available, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the acquisition system resolution.
Returns the total number of channels used during the recording.
Returns the sampling rate in microseconds.
Returns the acquisition system voltage range.
Returns the acquisition system offset.
Returns the acquisition system amplification.
Returns the number of samples used to describe a waveform.
Returns the sample index of the peak.
Returns the list of channels of the current electrode.
Creates and returns an sampleWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster with the specified nbSampleSpikes number of spikes.

detaileddescription.para:
This iterator iterates on the spikes selected for the sample mode presentation of the waveforms. In that mode, only a sample of the spikes evenly distributed on all the recording are available.
clusterId
the number of the cluster on which spikes the iterator will iterates.
nbSampleSpikes
number of spikes selected for the sample mode presentation.
the sampleWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

briefdescription.para: Creates and returns an TimeFrameWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

detaileddescription.para:
This iterator iterates on the spikes selected for the time frame mode presentation of the waveforms. In that mode, all the spikes in a given time frame are available.
clusterId
the number of the cluster on which spikes the iterator will iterates.
startTime
starting time selected for the time frame mode.
endTime
ending time selected for the time frame mode.
the TimeFrameWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

memberdef.argsstring: (Pair &pair, int binSize, int timeWindow, double binSizeInRU, float timeWindowInRU, int halfBins)
memberdef.name: getCorrelograms

briefdescription.para: Calculates the correlograms for each pair of clusters given in pairs.

parameterdescription.para: pair of clusters for which a correlogram has to be compute.
size of the bins to compute given in miliseconds.
time frame use to compute the correlograms, given in miliseconds.
size of the bins to compute given in recording units.
half of the time frame use to compute the correlograms, given in recording units.
the number of bins to compute are so there are a total of nBins = 1+2*halfBins bins (halfBins.5 for each halfTimeWindow).

simplesect.para: the status, READY if the data have already been calculated or the asked computation is finish, and IN_PROCESS if an other thread is already treating the pairs the thread has to do.

memberdef.argsstring: (Pair pair, ScaleMode scale, int binSize, int timeframe)
memberdef.name: correlogramIterator

briefdescription.para: Creates and returns an iterator on the correlogram data of the given pair of clusters (pair).

parameterdescription.para: the pair of clusters on which correlogram data the iterator will iterates.
the scale to applied to the correlogram's data (maximum value, shoulder value or no scale).
size of the bin used to compute the correlogram.
time frame used to compute the correlogram.

simplesect.para: the iterator on the correlogram data of the given pair.

memberdef.argsstring: (QValueList< int > &clustersToDelete, SortableTable *spikesByClusterTemp, ClusterInfoMap *clusterInfoMapTemp, long upperInsertionIndex, long &nbSpikesInNewCluster, int destinationId, QValueList< long > &positions, QValueList< long > &nbOfspikes)
memberdef.name: moveClusters

briefdescription.para: Moves the clusters contained in clustersToDelete to a the cluster destinationId.

detaileddescription.para:
The correponding spikes are assign to cluster destinationId
clustersToDelete
a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters to delete.
spikesByClusterTemp
the new spikesByCluster which will contain the new distribution of the spikes among the clusters
clusterInfoMapTemp
the new clusterInfoMap which will contain the information on the new clusters
upperInsertionIndex
the starting position in spikesByCluster where to insert the spikes which are moved
nbSpikesInNewCluster
the current number of spikes in the new cluster
destinationId
the cluster id of destination (0 for artifact or 1for noise)
positions
list containing, for each cluster to delete, the position of its first spike in the new cluster's spikes (starting from the first spike of the new cluster).
nbOfspikes
list containing, for each cluster to delete, its number of spikes.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new thread to calculate the min and max of the dimensions when the cluster 0 is modified.
Gets the waveform points for cluster clusterId in the sample mode.

detaileddescription.para:
Take a sample of the spikes evenly distributed on all the recording.
clusterId
id of the cluster to get waveform information for.
nbSpkToDisplay
number of spikes to display.
the status, READY if the data have already been collected or the current collection is finish, and IN_PROCESS if an other thread is already treating clusterId.

briefdescription.para: Gets the waveform points for cluster clusterId in time frame mode.

detaileddescription.para:
Take all the spikes in a given time frame.
clusterId
id of the cluster to get waveform information for.
start
starting time in second
end
ending time in second.
the status, READY if the data have already been collected or the current collection is finish, and IN_PROCESS if an other thread is already treating that cluster.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the mean and the standard deviation for cluster clusterId in the sample mode.

detaileddescription.para:
In that mode, the spikes used are a sample of the spikes evenly distributed on all the recording.
clusterId
id of the cluster to calculate the data for.
nbSpkToDisplay
number of spikes diplayed.
the status, READY if the data have already been calculated or the current calculation is finish, IN_PROCESS if an other thread is already treating that cluster and NOT_AVAILABLE if the spikes have not been collected yet.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the mean and the standard deviation for cluster clusterId in the time frame mode.

detaileddescription.para:
In that mode, all the spikes in a given time frame are selected.
clusterId
id of the cluster to calculate the data for.
start
starting time in second
end
ending time in second.
the status, READY if the data have already been calculated or the current calculation is finish, IN_PROCESS if an other thread is already treating that cluster and NOT_AVAILABLE if the spikes have not been collected yet.

memberdef.argsstring: (dataType clusterId, QValueList< dataType > currentClusterList, bool cleanProcess=false)
memberdef.name: cleanCorrelation

briefdescription.para: Remove all the correlations link to the cluster clusterId.

detaileddescription.para:
This mean remove the corresponding entries from correlationMap.
clusterId
id of the cluster for which the cleaning has been asked.
currentClusterList
list of the clusters to look for cleaning.
cleanProcess
true if the cluster has to be remove from correlationInProcess false otherwise. The default is false.

briefdescription.para: Renumber all the correlations.

parameterdescription.para: map between old and new cluster ids.

briefdescription.para: Returns the time corresponding to a spike.

parameterdescription.para: one row SortableTable corresponding to the position of the cluser's spikes in features sorted by position.
position.

memberdef.argsstring: (ClusterInfoMap *clusterInfoMapTemp, SortableTable *spikesByClusterTemp, dataType clusterId, QValueList< dataType > positions, QValueList< dataType > nbOfspikes, int step, bool fromTop=false)
memberdef.name: sortCluster

briefdescription.para: Sorts by time the spikes of a newly created cluster created from other clusters, knowing that the spikes from the other clusters are already sorted.

parameterdescription.para: the new clusterInfoMap which will contain the information on the new clusters.
the new spikesByCluster which will contain the new distribution of the spikes among the clusters.
the id of the cluster to sort.
list containing, for each contributing cluster, the position of either its last spike (if fromTop is false) or its first spike (if fromTop is true) in the new cluster's spikes.
list containing, for each contributing cluster, its number of spikes.
equals -1 if the contributing clusters are sorted from the bigger to the smaller and equals 1 if the contributing clusters are sorted from the smaller to the bigger.
true if the position is given starting from the first spike of the new cluster, false if it is given starting from the last spike of the new cluster. The default is false.

memberdef.argsstring: (ClusterInfoMap *clusterInfoMapTemp, SortableTable *spikesByClusterTemp, dataType clusterId, QValueList< dataType > lastPositions, QValueList< dataType > nbOfspikes, dataType firstPosition, dataType number)
memberdef.name: sortCluster

briefdescription.para: Sorts by time the spikes of a newly created cluster created from other clusters.

detaileddescription.para:
The function is an overload of the previous one for the cases where the cluster to sort is either the cluster 0 or the cluster 1. In that case the spikes coming from those clusters are sorted from the smaller time to the bigger whereas the other clusters still sorted from the bigger to the smaller.
clusterInfoMapTemp
the new clusterInfoMap which will contain the information on the new clusters.
spikesByClusterTemp
the new spikesByCluster which will contain the new distribution of the spikes among the clusters.
clusterId
the id of the cluster to sort.
lastPositions
list containing, for each contributing cluster, the position of its last spike in the new cluster's spikes (starting from the last spike of the new cluster).
nbOfspikes
list containing, for each contributing cluster, tits number of spikes.e
firstPosition
position of the first spike of the cluster 0 or 1.
number
number of spikes of either the cluster 0 or 1.

briefdescription.para: Finds the closest spike to a given time time among the pikes contain in spikesOfCluster.

parameterdescription.para: the time look up.
array of sorted spikes in which to look up.

briefdescription.para: Makes a copy of the internal variables, spikesOfCluster and clusterInfoMap, used to store insformation about the clusters.

parameterdescription.para: pointer on a SortableTable which will point on a copy of the internal variable spikesOfCluster.
pointer on a ClusterInfoMap which will point on a copy of the internal variable clusterInfoMap.

briefdescription.para: This class contains and manages the data.
